channel.title: math.HO updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.HO updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Book I of Euclid's Elements and application of areas
item.description: arXiv:2502.13387v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We work through Book I of Euclid's Elements with our focus on application of areas (I.42, I.44, I.45). We summarize alternate constructions from medieval editions of Euclid's elements and ancient and medieval commentaries. We remark that Euclid's proof of I.44 involves a seldom commented on use of superposition, but that several medieval editions of Euclid give constructions that avoid the use of superposition. This use of superposition is also avoided in Ralph Abraham's "VCE: The Visual Constructions of Euclid" C#12, C#12B at http://www.visual-euclid.org/vce/contents.html We collate the figures with the digitized editions of Euclid at (P) Biblioteca Apostolica Vaticana (BAV), Vat. gr. 190, (F) Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Plut. 28.03, (B) Bodleian, MS. D'Orville 301, (V) \"Osterreichische Nationalbibliothek, Cod. Phil. gr. 31 Han
item.dc:creator: Jordan Bell

item.title: An elementary algebraic proof of the fundamental theorem of algebra
item.description: arXiv:2502.13273v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We give a new proof of the fundamental theorem of algebra. It is entirely elementary, focused on using long division to its fullest extent. Further, the method quickly recovers a more general version of the theorem recently obtained by Joseph Shipman.
item.dc:creator: Katelyn S. Clark, Pace P. Nielsen
